title: Adjustable-Rate Mortgages Are Back, But They’re Not Like You Remember
sub_head: Gone are the ultralow teaser rates and lax lending requirements. Today’s ARMs are safer and so are borrowers.
body:
A jump in interest rates has revived demand for adjustable-rate mortgages. But these loans bear little resemblance to the ones blamed for fueling the 2008-09 financial crisis.
Applications for ARMs, a kind of mortgage that carries a lower rate in the loan’s early years, more than doubled in April from a year earlier, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association. More than 9% of mortgage applications submitted last week were for adjustable-rate mortgages, up from 4% a year ago.
